verses.verse: "How <S%H2009><s%> beautiful <S%H3303><s%> you are, my darling, <S%H7474><s%> How <S%H2009><s%> beautiful <S%H3303><s%> you are! Your eyes <S%H5869><s%> are [like] doves <S%H3123><s%> behind <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1157><s%> your veil; <S%H6777><s%> Your hair <S%H8181><s%> is like a flock <S%H5739><s%> of goats <S%H5795><s%> That have descended <S%H1570><s%> from Mount <S%H2022><s%> Gilead. <S%H1568><s%>

"Your teeth <S%H8127><s%> are like a flock <S%H5739><s%> of [newly] shorn <S%H7094><s%> ewes Which <S%H7945><s%> have come <S%H5927><s%> up from [their] washing, <S%H7367><s%> All <S%H3605><s%> of which <S%H7945><s%> bear <S%H8382><s%> twins, <S%H8382><s%> And not one <S%H369><s%> among them has lost <S%H9599><s%> her young. <S%H9599><s%>

"Your lips <S%H8193><s%> are like a scarlet <S%H8144><s%> thread, <S%H2339><s%> And your mouth <S%H9245><s%> is lovely. <S%H5000><s%> Your temples <S%H7541><s%> are like a slice <S%H6400><s%> of a pomegranate <S%H7416><s%> Behind <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1157><s%> your veil. <S%H6777><s%>

"Your neck <S%H6677><s%> is like the tower <S%H4026><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%> Built <S%H1129><s%> with rows <S%H8530><s%> of stones, <S%H8530><s%> On which are hung <S%H8518><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> shields, <S%H4043><s%> All <S%H3605><s%> the round shields <S%H7982><s%> of the mighty <S%H1368><s%> men. <S%H1368><s%>
"Your two <S%H8147><s%> breasts <S%H7699><s%> are like two <S%H8147><s%> fawns, <S%H6082><s%> Twins <S%H9639><s%> of a gazelle, <S%H6646><s%> Which feed <S%H7462><s%> among the lilies. <S%H7799><s%>

"Until <S%H5704><s%> the cool <S%H6315><s%> of the day <S%H3117><s%> When the shadows <S%H6738><s%> flee <S%H5127><s%> away, I will go <S%H1980><s%> my way <S%H1980><s%> to the mountain <S%H2022><s%> of myrrh <S%H4753><s%> And to the hill <S%H1389><s%> of frankincense. <S%H3828><s%>
"You are altogether <S%H3605><s%> beautiful, <S%H3303><s%> my darling, <S%H7474><s%> And there <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> blemish <S%H9249><s%> in you.

"[Come <S%H935><s%>] with me from Lebanon, <S%H3844><s%> [my] bride, <S%H3618><s%> May you come with me from Lebanon. <S%H3844><s%> Journey <S%H7788><s%> down <S%H7788><s%> from the summit <S%H7218><s%> of Amana, <S%H549><s%> From the summit <S%H7218><s%> of Senir <S%H8149><s%> and Hermon, <S%H2768><s%> From the dens <S%H4585><s%> of lions, <S%H738><s%> From the mountains <S%H2022><s%> of leopards. <S%H5246><s%>

"You have made my heart <S%H3823><s%> beat <S%H3823><s%> faster, <S%H3823><s%> my sister, <S%H269><s%> [my] bride; <S%H3618><s%> You have made my heart <S%H3823><s%> beat <S%H3823><s%> faster <S%H3823><s%> with a single <S%H259><s%> [glance] of your eyes, <S%H5869><s%> With a single <S%H259><s%> strand <S%H6060><s%> of your necklace. <S%H9477><s%>

"How <S%H4100><s%> beautiful <S%H3302><s%> is your love, <S%H1730><s%> my sister, <S%H269><s%> [my] bride! <S%H3618><s%> How <S%H4100><s%> much better <S%H2896><s%> is your love <S%H1730><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> wine, <S%H3196><s%> And the fragrance <S%H7381><s%> of your oils <S%H8081><s%> Than <S%H4480><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> [kinds] of spices! <S%H1314><s%>

"Your lips, <S%H8193><s%> [my] bride, <S%H3618><s%> drip <S%H5197><s%> honey; <S%H5317><s%> Honey <S%H1706><s%> and milk <S%H2461><s%> are under <S%H8478><s%> your tongue, <S%H3956><s%> And the fragrance <S%H7381><s%> of your garments <S%H8008><s%> is like the fragrance <S%H7381><s%> of Lebanon. <S%H3844><s%>

"A garden <S%H1588><s%> locked <S%H5274><s%> is my sister, <S%H269><s%> [my] bride, <S%H3618><s%> A rock <S%H1530><s%> garden <S%H1530><s%> locked, <S%H5274><s%> a spring <S%H4599><s%> sealed <S%H2856><s%> up.

"Your shoots <S%H7973><s%> are an orchard <S%H6508><s%> of pomegranates <S%H7416><s%> With choice <S%H4022><s%> fruits, <S%H4022><s%> <S%H6529><s%> henna <S%H9218><s%> with nard <S%H5373><s%> plants, <S%H5373><s%>

Nard <S%H5373><s%> and saffron, <S%H3750><s%> calamus <S%H7070><s%> and cinnamon, <S%H7076><s%> With all <S%H3605><s%> the trees <S%H6086><s%> of frankincense, <S%H3828><s%> Myrrh <S%H4753><s%> and aloes, <S%H174><s%> along <S%H5973><s%> with all <S%H3605><s%> the finest <S%H7218><s%> spices. <S%H1314><s%>
"[You are] a garden <S%H1588><s%> spring, <S%H4599><s%> A well <S%H875><s%> of fresh <S%H2416><s%> water, <S%H4325><s%> And streams <S%H5140><s%> [flowing] from Lebanon. <S%H3844><s%>"

"Awake, <S%H5782><s%> O north <S%H6828><s%> [wind,] And come, <S%H935><s%> [wind of] the south; <S%H8486><s%> Make my garden <S%H1588><s%> breathe <S%H6315><s%> out [fragrance,] Let its spices <S%H1314><s%> be wafted <S%H5140><s%> abroad. May my beloved <S%H1730><s%> come <S%H935><s%> into his garden <S%H1588><s%> And eat <S%H398><s%> its choice <S%H4022><s%> fruits! <S%H6529><s%>"
